intro: Papaver roopianum, commonly known as the Kashmiri poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The seeds of Papaver roopianum are small and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution across mountainous regions.
